similars.text: And they said, Thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.

And now if ye are not the sheep of the good shepherd, of what fold are ye? Behold, I say unto you, that the devil is your shepherd, and ye are of his fold; and now, who can deny this? Behold, I say unto you, whosoever denieth this is a liar and a child of the devil.
The words of Christ, which he spake unto his disciples, the twelve whom he had chosen, as he laid his hands upon them--
And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words, he said unto those twelve whom he had chosen:
Then the angel that talked with me answered and said unto me, Knowest thou not what these be? And I said, No, my lord.
We be twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.

Therefore will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when I called, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.
They looked, but there was none to save; even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.

I say unto you, Nay; except ye make our Creator a liar from the beginning, or suppose that he is a liar from the beginning, ye cannot suppose that such can have place in the kingdom of heaven; but they shall be cast out for they are the children of the kingdom of the devil.
I am he who said--Other sheep have I which are not of this fold--unto my disciples, and many there were that understood me not.

verses.text: He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.

similars.text: And Saul spake to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David.
The words of Christ, which he spake unto his disciples, the twelve whom he had chosen, as he laid his hands upon them--
And they said, Thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
We be twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.

That the cruelty done to the threescore and ten sons of Jerubbaal might come, and their blood be laid upon Abimelech their brother, which slew them; and upon the men of Shechem, which aided him in the killing of his brethren.

And David's heart smote him after that he had numbered the people. And David said unto the Lord, I have sinned greatly in that I have done: and now, I beseech thee, O Lord, take away the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
And he, supposing that I spake of the brethren of the church, and that I was truly that Laban whom I had slain, wherefore he did follow me.

For what man among you having twelve sons, and is no respecter of them, and they serve him obediently, and he saith unto the one: Be thou clothed in robes and sit thou here; and to the other: Be thou clothed in rags and sit thou there--and looketh upon his sons and saith I am just?
The ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the enemy of the Jews, slew they; but on the spoil laid they not their hand.
The fifteenth to Jeremoth, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
